meanings.definition: An effort or striving to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her conatus to excel in school was evident in her dedication to studying every day.
meanings.sent2: The team's conatus to win the championship motivated them to train harder.
meanings.sent3: His conatus to bake the perfect cake led to a messy but delicious outcome.
meanings.sent4: The conatus of the seed to grow into a mighty tree is a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent5: The conatus of the river to reach the ocean is unstoppable and inspiring.

meanings.definition: The tendency of an object to continue in motion.
meanings.sent1: The conatus of the ball rolling down the hill was unstoppable.
meanings.sent2: According to Newton's first law, an object in motion will remain in motion due to its conatus.
meanings.sent3: The conatus of the car to keep moving made it difficult to stop at the red light.
meanings.sent4: The conatus of the planets to orbit the sun creates the harmony of the solar system.
meanings.sent5: The conatus of the wind to sway the trees creates a soothing rhythm in nature.
